questions.full_question_text: The wind sliding down a hill during night is called ___ wind.

options: Strong and blowing across the isobars
questions.solution: Strong and blowing across the isobars

questions.full_question_text: Anabatic wind occurs
options: Any time of day and night

questions.full_question_text: Sudden change in wind speed form 10kt to 30kt an then 15 kt are
Sudden change in wind speed from 10 kt to 30 kt for 2-3 minutes
Why does air cool as it rises?
options: The air is colder at higher latitudes
The air is colder at higher altitudes

questions.full_question_text: Which of the following zones is most likely to encounter little or no precipitation?
options: The north side of the alps with a prevailing Foehn from the south.
The north side of the alps with a prevailing Foehn from the north.
questions.solution: The north side of the alps with a prevailing Foehn from the south.

options: calm wind, little clouding and practically no rainfall
questions.solution: calm wind, little clouding and practically no rainfall

questions.full_question_text: Rainfall occurs all over the country during monsoon when
options: Axis of MT is in its normal position along Gangetic plains.
Axis of MT is along Himalayas
Depression formed over Bay of Bengal
questions.solution: Axis of MT is in its normal position along Gangetic plains.

After landing at an aerodrome (QNH 993 hPa) it is noticed that the altimeter is still set to 1013.2 hPa and that it reads 1200 feet. What is the elevation of the aerodrome above mean sea level ?
An altimeter adjusted to 1013 hPa indicates an altitude of 3600 FT. Should this altimeter be adjusted to the local QNH value of 991 hPa, the altitude indicated would be
During a conventional approach, the Minimum Descent Height (MDH) is referred to the runway threshold altitude and not to the aerodrome altitude if the runway threshold is at more than
options: 2 m (7 ft) below the airdrome altitude
2 m (7 ft) above the airdrome altitude
4 m (14 ft) below the airdrome altitude
4 m (14 ft) above the airdrome altitude
questions.solution: 2 m (7 ft) below the airdrome altitude

questions.full_question_text: Advection fog occurs due to ___ air moving over ___ surface over ___
options: Moist and cold, warm, land only
Warm & moist air, cold, both land & sea
questions.solution: Warm & moist air, cold, both land & sea

questions.full_question_text: Density altitude is
options: Higher if atmosphere is warmer than ISA
Lower if atmosphere is warmer than ISA
Higher if atmosphere is colder than ISA
questions.solution: Higher if atmosphere is warmer than ISA

questions.full_question_text: Which is not true of post monsoon
options: Pressure gradient is weakest of all seasons
Frequency of tropical cyclones is max
Worst period for flying expect S India
questions.solution: Pressure gradient is weakest of all seasons
